content:
• Thursday, December 6, 2012
  • ENPH

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ENPH +6%. GEO +6%. FSGI +4%. BAGL +3%. MBTF +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ENPH +6%. GEO +6%. FSGI +4%. BAGL +3%. MBTF +3%.
    After-hours top losers: AMRN -20%. MBLX -7%. QRE -5%. QCOR -3%. KONG -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENB

    Enbridge (NYSE:ENB) +2.8% AH as it boosts its dividend by 12%, projects a strong growth outlook...

    Enbridge (NYSE:ENB) +2.8% AH as it boosts its dividend by 12%, projects a strong growth outlook and reveals plans to invest C$3.4B in a program to expand access to markets for growing volumes of North Dakota and western Canada light oil production. Expansion of the Seaway pipeline to 400K bbl/day will be completed in Q1 2013 as scheduled, CEO Al Monaco says.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • TREE

    Tree.com (NASDAQ:TREE) declares special dividend of $1.00/share. For shareholders of record Dec....

    Tree.com (NASDAQ:TREE) declares special dividend of $1.00/share. For shareholders of record Dec. 17. Payable Dec. 26. Ex-div date Dec. 13. Shares +3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • CMTL

    Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) declares $0.275/share quarterly dividend, in line with...

    Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) declares $0.275/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 4.26%. For shareholders of record Dec. 17. Payable Dec. 27. Ex-div date Dec. 13. The board authorized additional share repurchase of $50M. Shares -11.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • GEO

    The GEO Group (NYSE:GEO) declares special dividend of $5.68/share in connection with with REIT...

    The GEO Group (NYSE:GEO) declares special dividend of $5.68/share in connection with with REIT conversion. For shareholders of record Dec. 21. Payable Dec. 31. Ex-div date Dec. 19. The board estimates dividend of $2.20/share to $2.40/share in FY13. Shares +5.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • AOBC

    More on Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ2 results come in largely in-line with estimates. Net...

    More on Smith & Wesson (SWHC): FQ2 results come in largely in-line with estimates. Net profit rose as the gun maker's sales and margins continued to strengthen. The company again raised its full-year outlook, now projecting per-share earnings between $1 and $1.05 and sales of $555M to $560M. It previously projected earnings of $0.85 to $0.90 cents a share and net sales of $530M to $540M. Shares +2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -4.1%) closed lower, possibly on news a Virginia woman has been hit with a $750K...

    Yelp (YELP -4.1%) closed lower, possibly on news a Virginia woman has been hit with a $750K defamation suit from a contractor thanks to a critical Yelp review. A judge has ordered comments from the reviewer suggesting the contractor stole jewelry be removed. Legal experts argue such comments aren't legally protected, unlike opinions on service quality.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • QRE

    QR Energy (NYSE:QRE) -4.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 12M common units...

    QR Energy (NYSE:QRE) -4.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 12M common units representing limited partner interests. QRE plans to use the net proceeds to repay debt and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) announces $100M in non-equity financing with an investment fund managed by...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) announces $100M in non-equity financing with an investment fund managed by Pharmakon Advisors, and that it's continuing preparations to commercialize Vascepa capsules by hiring a sales force in the United States. Payments under this hybrid debt-like instrument are expected to be made over a 3.5-year period commencing in November 2013 and to continue through early 2017. Shares -21% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 16 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW): FQ1 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $85.9M (+50% Y/Y)...

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW): FQ1 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $85.9M (+50% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares -4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson Holding (SWHC): FQ2 EPS of $0.24 in-line. Revenue of $136.5M (+48% Y/Y) beats...

    Smith & Wesson Holding (SWHC): FQ2 EPS of $0.24 in-line. Revenue of $136.5M (+48% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • COO

    Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ4 EPS of $1.47 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $396.3M (+10% Y/Y)...

    Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ4 EPS of $1.47 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $396.3M (+10% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +3.6%) has closed higher with the help of another positive note from Janney's Tony...

    TiVo (TIVO +3.6%) has closed higher with the help of another positive note from Janney's Tony Wilbe, who suggests Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) could acquire the DVR maker (market cap of $1.48B) rather than have its Motorola Mobility unit pay an enormous settlement. Wilbe argues the legal interpretations made for patents in TiVo's suit will make it very hard for Motorola to win, and estimates Motorola would have to pay $720M in damages if TiVo received $0.50/unit in damages for set-tops shipped over a 6-year period. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • YTEN

    Shares of Metabolix (MBLX +33%) surge even higher into the close after the company announced...

    Shares of Metabolix (MBLX +33%) surge even higher into the close after the company announced earlier today that it will work with UCLA's School of Engineering and Applied Science to redesign carbon fixation pathways to increase the efficiency of capturing energy from sunlight. This is the third grant awarded to MBLX this year for crop research targeting multi-gene expression and transformation of plants. Funding from the three grants will total around $1M and runs through 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • FCX

    It's been an ugly two days for Freeport McMoRan (FCX -4.2%), which has lost $7.1B in value since...

    It's been an ugly two days for Freeport McMoRan (FCX -4.2%), which has lost $7.1B in value since news of its two big oil deals, more than the $6.9B it's paying for Plains Exploration. Shares have skidded 21% to just under $31 each. Although Oracle Research issues an afternoon upgrade, downgrades rule the day. On Nov. 30, FCX’s consensus target price was $48.83; today it’s at $42.76.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI +5%) moves up after reporting a largely in-line FQ4, but a 16%...

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI +5%) moves up after reporting a largely in-line FQ4, but a 16% Y/Y jump in total revenue. Net profit also rose 23%, as the company again recorded strong revenue growth, despite the impact of Hurricane Sandy on the Northeast regional provider of diagnostic testing for physicians. Revenue per patient rose 4% in the latest quarter, while the number of patients served rose 12%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD +5.5%) shares are strong as TPG-Axon, agitating for changes at the company...

    SandRidge Energy (SD +5.5%) shares are strong as TPG-Axon, agitating for changes at the company including the ouster of CEO Tom Ward, launches a website providing detailed information regarding how SD shareholders may cast their votes in favor of the hedge fund’s proposals.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • BWXT

    Babcock & Wilcox (BWC +1%) trades higher after the company detailed plans to boost its stock...

    Babcock & Wilcox (BWC +1%) trades higher after the company detailed plans to boost its stock buyback program over the near-term up to a total of $150M. BWC previously said it planned to acquire $100M of stock before March 31, 2013 as part of its larger $250M plan announced in in November. CEO E. James Ferland notes long-term value in the company that's not currently being reflected in the stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco (CSCO +1.3%) and Juniper (JNPR +3.9%) are higher, possibly aided by a Credit Suisse note...

    Cisco (CSCO +1.3%) and Juniper (JNPR +3.9%) are higher, possibly aided by a Credit Suisse note downplaying the threat posed by software-defined networking (SDN) solutions, such as those offered by VMware's (NYSE:VMW) Nicira.  CS notes most of the IT pros it spoke with at a conference were "simply trying to understand what is SDN," and argues Cisco has a "practical and flexible" SDN strategy (I, II, III). Others have suggested SDN fragmentation between controller standards pushed by Cisco, Nicira, and the OpenFlow camp are a problem. Cisco's analyst day is tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • GNMX

    Medgenics (MDGN -1.2%) says it's received a Notice of Allowance from the Japanese Patent and...

    Medgenics (MDGN -1.2%) says it's received a Notice of Allowance from the Japanese Patent and Trademark Office for key claims protecting the use of it's Infradure Biopump technology. The technology provides interferon therapy for the treatment of hepatitis B, C, and D. MDGN has already been granted patents covering core Biopump technology in the U.S. and in the EU.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • PRSN

    Midday top 10 gainers: BSDM +28%. EPHC +27%. MBLX +22%. INPH +18%. NVGN +18%. UEPS +17%. HITK...

    Midday top 10 gainers: BSDM +28%. EPHC +27%. MBLX +22%. INPH +18%. NVGN +18%. UEPS +17%. HITK +13%. CZR +11%. MITK +11%. CVO +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: OTC:ENZN -30%. TIGR -19%. SCMR -17%. NBY -16%. LFVN -14%. WEBM -14%. SNFCA -13%. KBW -13%. VRA -12%. HF -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • SNI

    Scripps Networks Interactive (SNI -2%) trades lower after getting slapped with a downgrade from...

    Scripps Networks Interactive (SNI -2%) trades lower after getting slapped with a downgrade from Goldman Sachs to Neutral from Buy. The firm sees profits slipping lower than prior estimates due to trimmed advertising forecasts. Another drag on shares is that the buzz over the company being a takeover candidate has died down quite a bit since October.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSRI

    Silver Standard Resources (SSRI +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy at Global Hunter after the miner's...

    Silver Standard Resources (SSRI +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy at Global Hunter after the miner's feasibility study on the Pitarrilla project in Mexico showed an after-tax net present value of $737M and a 12.8% internal rate of return with $741M in initial capital required for construction.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM

  • MiMedx (MDXG +2%) says it's been issued its first placental-based U.S. patent covering its...

    MiMedx (MDXG +2%) says it's been issued its first placental-based U.S. patent covering its AmnioFix-brand allografts. The patent application was originally filed in September 2007 and granted late yesterday. MDXG currently has 25 additional patent applications relating to the use of placental tissue allografts on file with the USPTO, and expects more to be issued in the near future.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • CP

    Analysts at Stifel Nicolaus come away impressed from Canadian Pacific’s (CP +3%) investor...

    Analysts at Stifel Nicolaus come away impressed from Canadian Pacific’s (CP +3%) investor workshop this week, raising shares to Buy with a $138 price target and citing a "dramatic change... in mindset and culture" evident just five months after the arrival of Hunter Harrison as CEO. Plenty of low-hanging fruit has been harvested and plenty more still exists, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • CRIS

    Curis (CRIS -3.8%) trades lower today, despite the company's earlier announcement that it's been...

    Curis (CRIS -3.8%) trades lower today, despite the company's earlier announcement that it's been issued a patent covering a genus of compounds that includes Debio 0932, an orally-administered Heat Shock Protein 90 inhibitor, which is being developed by Curis' licensee Debiopharm.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • RRTS

    Roadrunner Transportation Systems (RRTS -2.4%) slips after pricing its previously announced 3.5M...

    Roadrunner Transportation Systems (RRTS -2.4%) slips after pricing its previously announced 3.5M secondary offering at $17.25 per share, a 1.4% discount to yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • MITK

    Heavily-shorted Mitek (MITK +10.2%) is adding to the giant gains it saw yesterday on a deal with...

    Heavily-shorted Mitek (MITK +10.2%) is adding to the giant gains it saw yesterday on a deal with U.S. Bank that covers Mitek's Mobile Photo Bill Pay solution. A positive note from Compass Point Research could be helping.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • ALGN

    Invisalign manufacturer Align Technology (ALGN -5.4%) remains solidly in the red today, after...

    Invisalign manufacturer Align Technology (ALGN -5.4%) remains solidly in the red today, after saying earlier that Q4 profit and revenue will come in at the lower end of previously downbeat guidance, and that it's cutting around 25 jobs and shuffling management. The management changes follow the news that Dana Cambra, the company's VP of R&D, has left the company. Chief Executive Thomas M. Prescott will take his responsibilities on an interim basis.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • OLED

    Beaten-down Universal Display (PANL +9.6%) is up sharply. A likely reason: a Reuters column...

    Beaten-down Universal Display (PANL +9.6%) is up sharply. A likely reason: a Reuters column discussing expectations Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) Galaxy S IV will feature an "unbreakable" plastic display. That suggests the use of PANL's flexible OLED tech. Shares were crushed in November thanks to a Q3 miss blamed on Samsung's decision to hold off on ramping the use of PANL's green materials in its OLED displays. 30.7% of the float was shorted as of Nov. 15. (also: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • TITN

    Titan Machinery (TITN +4.3%) moves higher after beating on its Q3 bottom line this morning, as...

    Titan Machinery (TITN +4.3%) moves higher after beating on its Q3 bottom line this morning, as the manufacturer of building and farming equipment posted a 37% Y/Y gain in total sales. Net profit rose 9.9% on strong sales out of its agriculture segment, and despite an overall contraction in margins. The company also backed its EPS estimates and raised revenue expectations for the year, now forecasting $2B to $2.15B in sales, up from previous estimates of $1.95B to $2.1B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU +2.1%) CEO Christine Day tells CNBC that David Einhorn has not engaged the...

    Lululemon (LULU +2.1%) CEO Christine Day tells CNBC that David Einhorn has not engaged the company. If not exactly a boost for the company per se, scratching off a potential Einhorn attack from the list of investor concerns could help sentiment. (Earlier: earnings, conference call)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +5.8%) races higher with no news of note out on the retailer. Shares cracked...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +5.8%) races higher with no news of note out on the retailer. Shares cracked through the $19 barrier for the first time in a month before peeling back gains. CNBC's Carl Quintailla says a major rumor is behind the action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 9 Comments
  • DSCI

    Derma Sciences (DSCI +6.8%) gains after pricing its 3.06M share offering at $10.34 per share,...

    Derma Sciences (DSCI +6.8%) gains after pricing its 3.06M share offering at $10.34 per share, flat with yesterday's close. The stock has a current float of around 13M shares. The medical device and pharmaceutical company says it intends to use the proceeds to fund the clinical development of its pharmaceutical wound care product DSC127, along with other general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • IVAN

    Ivanhoe Energy (IVAN +6%) says it received Chinese government approval to transfer its interest...

    Ivanhoe Energy (IVAN +6%) says it received Chinese government approval to transfer its interest in the Zitong Block, Sichuan Basin, to Shell China Exploration and Production. IVAN says the approval sets the stage for it to increase its pre-tax working capital by $105M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • LVS

    Casino stocks trade higher after Zynga files initial paperwork to enter the real money gambling...

    Casino stocks trade higher after Zynga files initial paperwork to enter the real money gambling game. Traders may be betting that the entry of a well-known tech company into the mix could increase the chances politicians in DC may have to take up the issue of regulating the industry. Advancers: LVS +1.1%, MGM +4.1%, WYNN +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 3 Comments
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU -3.6%) is lower after receiving a downgrade to Market Perform from Raymond...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU -3.6%) is lower after receiving a downgrade to Market Perform from Raymond James: the firm cites valuation, high consensus estimates, and vertical integration efforts among customers. The decline comes even though rival Finisar (FNSR +4%) is rallying in response to its FQ2 results and FQ3 guidance. Oclaro (OCLR) is also down.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • LULU

    Execs with Lululemon (LULU +4.6%) indicate during the firm's conference call (webcast) that...

    Execs with Lululemon (LULU +4.6%) indicate during the firm's conference call (webcast) that global growth plans are still on track. The retailer will investigate opportunities in at least 15 different countries over the next few years and plants its flag in high-growth areas like Hong Kong. (Earlier: earnings)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • DAL

    Delta Airlines (NYSE:DAL) chooses Bombardier (OTCQX:BDRAF) over Embraer (ERJ -5.3%) and orders...

    Delta Airlines (NYSE:DAL) chooses Bombardier (OTCQX:BDRAF) over Embraer (ERJ -5.3%) and orders 40 CRJ900 NextGen regional jets from the Canadian company, and takes an option to acquire another 30 in a deal that could be worth up to $3.29B. The initial value is $1.85B. The booking adds to orders worth billions of dollars that Bombardier received from Berkshire Hathaway's NetJets and VistaJet.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) +6.8% after announcing a long-rumored CDN reseller deal with AT&T...

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) +6.8% after announcing a long-rumored CDN reseller deal with AT&T (NYSE:T). The companies say they'll offer "an exclusive suite of global CDN and telecom solutions" that rely on Akamai servers deployed on AT&T's network, and which will be jointly managed. Dan Rayburn reported in August Akamai was willing to guarantee AT&T $100M or more in sales, far more than Limelight (NASDAQ:LLNW) was offering. The deal is a coup for Akamai, especially since many carriers are looking to offer home-grown CDNs. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA) declares $0.06/share quarterly dividend, 100.0% increase from prior...

    Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA) declares $0.06/share quarterly dividend, 100.0% increase from prior dividend of $0.03. Forward yield 3.20%. For shareholders of record Dec. 17. Payable Dec. 28. Ex-div date Dec. 13. Shares +3.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • COST

    Shares of Costco (NASDAQ:COST) fall 7.1% premarket after the record date for its special...

    Shares of Costco (NASDAQ:COST) fall 7.1% premarket after the record date for its special dividend comes and goes. The dividend move by the retailer has drawn some debate because it needed to sell $3.5B in debt to make the $3B payment.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Stock futures are flat to higher in what looks set to be choppy trading after...

    Market preview: Stock futures are flat to higher in what looks set to be choppy trading after jobless claims come in below forecasts but as the U.S. continues to meander its merry way towards the fiscal cliff. The S&P Benchmark is +0.2%. Apple is -1.6% and looks set to add to its fall of 6.4% yesterday, its steepest drop in four years. Zynga zings 6.9% higher on its plans to become an online gambling force Nevada. Later: Quarterly Services Report
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • WLT

    Investors seem to take seriously the latest takeover chatter surrounding Walter Energy...

    Investors seem to take seriously the latest takeover chatter surrounding Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT), sending shares +7.5% premarket as vague rumors circulate that bidders could emerge. BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) is said to be interested again; Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF) could be another candidate; Anglo American has been mentioned in the past. Other coal names are up: ANR +1.9%, CNX +1.6%, ACI +1.3%, BTU +0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 5 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) -1.6% premarket, adding to a 6.4% Wednesday drop that seems to be related to...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) -1.6% premarket, adding to a 6.4% Wednesday drop that seems to be related to higher margin requirements, though a Digitimes column and even IDC's tablet share forecast have been named as possible reasons. TA believers note shares are nearing a "death cross" - the point where the 50-day moving average drops below the 200-day average. A Birinyi analyst observes Apple has historically struggled in the month following a cross, but outperformed in the following 3 months. Shares are back to trading around 8.4x FY13E EPS exc. cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 13 Comments
  • VRA

    Shares of Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) fall 9.5% premarket after guidance for Q4 came in short of...

    Shares of Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) fall 9.5% premarket after guidance for Q4 came in short of the estimates of analysts. On a conference call (transcipt), execs warn an inventory planning issue and a soft start to November will impact results negatively during the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • WLT

    Premarket gainers: WLT +7%. ZNGA +6%. AKAM +5%. Losers: OTC:ENZN -28%. VRA -10%. MW -10%. COST...

    Premarket gainers: WLT +7%. ZNGA +6%. AKAM +5%.
    Losers: OTC:ENZN -28%. VRA -10%. MW -10%. COST -7%. ERJ -6%. LFVN -6%. LVS -5%.
     
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) -2.5% premarket after receiving downgrades from at least a...

    Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) -2.5% premarket after receiving downgrades from at least a half-dozen firms, including Deutsche Bank, RBC, Goldman, Citi, Macquarie and BMO. The moves reflect investors' nasty mood that sank shares 16% yesterday following FCX's decision to engage in a diversification strategy that results in near-term earnings dilution and provides no apparent synergies.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 11 Comments
  • SU

    Suncor Energy (NYSE:SU) says average November production of ~312K bbl/day was lower than...

    Suncor Energy (NYSE:SU) says average November production of ~312K bbl/day was lower than expected due to unplanned maintenance. Full-year oil sands production is projected at the lower end of its 325K-340K bbl/day guidance range. Achieved first oil throughput at its Firebag 4 facility, three months ahead of schedule, producing ~130K bbl/day. SU -2.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • PLX

    Protalix (PLX +5.5%) signs an agreement with Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) in which the latter will conduct...

    Protalix (PLX +5.5%) signs an agreement with Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) in which the latter will conduct and sponsor new trials for Protalix's Elelyso treatment for Gaucher disease, which stops cells and organs from working properly. Protalix will be eligible to receive milestone payments of up $8.3M; the company will continue to conduct existing trials of Elelyso. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 3 Comments
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) announces a $2B stock repurchase program and special cash dividend...

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) announces a $2B stock repurchase program and special cash dividend of $0.05 per share to be paid before the end of the year. SIRI +2.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) fall 2.8% premarket after the firm's tepid guidance throws a...

    Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) fall 2.8% premarket after the firm's tepid guidance throws a bit of a scare into investors. The retailer sees Q4 sales growing in the high single digits, but double-digit levels were already baked into LULU's share price. NBG's Brian Sozzi thinks with 50% of its assets in cash, Lululemon might take stab at an acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • TD

    TD Bank (NYSE:TD) expands its U.S. wealth management business with a deal to buy Epoch Holding...

    TD Bank (NYSE:TD) expands its U.S. wealth management business with a deal to buy Epoch Holding (NASDAQ:EPHC) for $668M cash, or $28/share (Wednesday's close: $21.91). The bank expects to add about $24B in AUM to the $207B it already has. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 AM | 1 Comment

  • The WSJ shines a light on the practice of "marking the close" or "portfolio pumping," when money...

    The WSJ shines a light on the practice of "marking the close" or "portfolio pumping," when money managers make aggressive bids for shares in a company they already own in the final moments of a quarter. That drives up the value of their entire holding, boosting their quarterly performance and enabling them to attract new money and generate higher fees. While the practice breaks laws on deceptive trading, it's hard to prosecute.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 AM

  • Asian shares stay in their holding pattern while European shares are higher as the U.S. fiscal...

    Asian shares stay in their holding pattern while European shares are higher as the U.S. fiscal cliff talks continue to dominate sentiment. The ECB is due to meet later, when it's expected to leave its benchmark interest rate at 0.75% but also to cut its economic forecasts. Japan +0.8%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China -0.1%, India -0.4%. Euro Stoxx 50 +0.7%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.6%, Frankfurt +0.9%, Milan +0.5%, Madrid +0.55%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 AM

    Rolls-Royce (RRCEF.PK) -3.2% in London after saying a company review has "identified matters of...

    Rolls-Royce (RRCEF.PK) -3.2% in London after saying a company review has "identified matters of concern" in its business dealings in China, Indonesia and other markets. Rolls has passed its findings to the U.K.'s Serious Fraud Office, which had made a request for information about allegations of malpractice in Indonesia and China. The company will now appoint an independent auditor to look at its anti-corruption procedures. (PR)

    AAA ratings - who needs 'em? Debt twice the size of the GDP - so what? Yields on French 10-year bonds dropped below 2% for the first time yesterday, touching a record low of 1.993%. They're now at 1.996%. Meanwhile, Japan's JGBs touch 0.69%, the lowest since June 2003.
